issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The following parameter/property has no effect:

"<partition>.storage.storeprefix Prefix for ISCSI device"

Steps to reproduce:

1) Grab a working cloud with DAS or overlay backend
2) Modify the property:

{code}euca-modify-property -p cluster01.storage.storeprefix=emea-test-lab{code}

3) Create a volume and attach it to an instance
4) Run {code}tgt-admin --show{code} on the SC and observe the store name prefix has no effect

comments.body: [~lwade], is this a request to make it work, or to remove the option? I assume it is preferable to make it work, but do we have users that need this functionality or is it a "nice-to-have"?

[~zhill], [~lwade], I tested this using the latest code from testing branch (post 4.0.2) and I see that <cluster>.storage.storeprefix is being used as the prefix in the target IQN of the exported volume. Is this the expected behavior? If yes, I can go ahead and mark it as fixed. 

On my DAS cloud setup provisioned by the QA system, storageprefix was already set
{noformat}
# euca-describe-properties | grep PARTI03.storage.storeprefix
PROPERTY        PARTI03.storage.storeprefix     iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.
{noformat}

Created and attached a volume. Ran 'tgt-admin --show' on SC, notice the Target 26 IQN in the below output 
{noformat}
# tgt-admin --show
Target 26: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.PARTI03:store26
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:
        I_T nexus: 26
            Initiator: iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:db664c64e80
            Connection: 0
                IP Address: 10.111.1.176
    LUN information:
        LUN: 0
            Type: controller
            SCSI ID: IET     001a0000
            SCSI SN: beaf260
            Size: 0 MB, Block size: 1
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Prevent removal: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: null
            Backing store path: None
            Backing store flags: 
        LUN: 1
            Type: disk
            SCSI ID: IET     001a0001
            SCSI SN: beaf261
            Size: 2147 MB, Block size: 512
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Prevent removal: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: rdwr
            Backing store path: /dev/vg01/euca-vol-a3976303
            Backing store flags: 
    Account information:
        eucalyptus
    ACL information:
        ALL
{noformat}

iscsiadm session on the NC also reflects the store prefix in target IQN 
{noformat}
# iscsiadm -m session -P3
iSCSI Transport Class version 2.0-870
version 6.2.0-873.10.el6
Target: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.PARTI03:store26
        Current Portal: 10.111.1.56:3260,1
        Persistent Portal: 10.111.1.56:3260,1
                **********
                Interface:
                **********
                Iface Name: default
                Iface Transport: tcp
                Iface Initiatorname: iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:db664c64e80
                Iface IPaddress: 10.111.1.176
                Iface HWaddress: <empty>
                Iface Netdev: <empty>
                SID: 26
                iSCSI Connection State: LOGGED IN
                iSCSI Session State: LOGGED_IN
                Internal iscsid Session State: NO CHANGE
                *********
                Timeouts:
                *********
                Recovery Timeout: 120
                Target Reset Timeout: 30
                LUN Reset Timeout: 30
                Abort Timeout: 15
                *****
                CHAP:
                *****
                username: eucalyptus
                password: ********
                username_in: <empty>
                password_in: ********
                ************************
                Negotiated iSCSI params:
                ************************
                HeaderDigest: None
                DataDigest: None
                MaxRecvDataSegmentLength: 262144
                MaxXmitDataSegmentLength: 8192
                FirstBurstLength: 65536
                MaxBurstLength: 262144
                ImmediateData: Yes
                InitialR2T: Yes
                MaxOutstandingR2T: 1
                ************************
                Attached SCSI devices:
                ************************
                Host Number: 31 State: running
                scsi31 Channel 00 Id 0 Lun: 0
                scsi31 Channel 00 Id 0 Lun: 1
                        Attached scsi disk sdc          State: running
{noformat}

Modifying the storeprefix reflected changes in the target IQN of the exported volume
{noformat}
# euca-modify-property -p PARTI03.storage.storeprefix=foobar
PROPERTY        PARTI03.storage.storeprefix     foobar was iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.
{noformat}

After attaching a volume on the SC
{noformat}
# tgt-admin --show
Target 27: foobarPARTI03:store27
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:
        I_T nexus: 27
            Initiator: iqn.1994-05.com.redhat:db664c64e80
            Connection: 0
                IP Address: 10.111.1.176
    LUN information:
        LUN: 0

            Size: 2147 MB, Block size: 512
            Online: Yes

            Backing store type: rdwr
            Backing store path: /dev/vg01/euca-vol-037a23d8
            Backing store flags:

{noformat}

iscsiadm session information on NC
{noformat}
# iscsiadm -m session -P3
Target: foobarPARTI03:store27
        Current Portal: 10.111.1.56:3260,1
        Persistent Portal: 10.111.1.56:3260,1

[~lwade], feel free to reopen the ticket if you continue seeing the issue.
